name: NALA
headline: Building Payments for the Next Billion.
description:
Story here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PPsHg3Ap_qw

We have two products: 
1. Consumer Cross Border payments to Emerging Market: nala.com
2. Payment Rails for Africa: rafiki.com

founders.name: Benjamin Fernandes, Founder
founders.description:
when i'm not building, i'm thinking about food. 

I'm Tanzanian. 

Northwestern BA, Stanford MBA, Harvard Exec Ed.

I'm confident Africa will lead the world in digital payments.

What are the transaction limits for NALA accounts?
Transaction limits for NALA accounts are up to $Â£â‚¬5,000 daily. This mayvary based on factors such as the sender's country, account type, and purpose of transactions. Whether you're a personal account holder or a business owner, we've covered you.

How long does it take to send my money with NALA?
The time it takes to deliver your funds depends on the type of transfer that you make, with 95% of our transfers are delivered within a few minutes. [Here](http://nala.com/<https:/help.nala.money/en/articles/5520797-how-long-does-it-take-to-send-my-money>) you will find a summary of transfer times to mobile money wallets and to bank accounts.
How much does it cost to use NALA?
NALA does not charge any fees for mobile money transfers, with the exception of a small margin embedded in the exchange rate. Please note that in some instances for bank transfers, NALA might charge a small fee to offset the bank processing charge on each transaction.
All fees will be clearly displayed in the app before you complete a transfer.With no hidden costs, you can always be sure that you are getting the best value on your money transfers.

**Company Overview: NALA**

**Mission**: NALA is on a mission to build payments for the next billion people. They aim to simplify and reduce the costs of cross-border transactions, especially for communities in emerging markets.

**Founding Story**: NALA initially emerged from innovative ideas discussed in a Y Combinator Batch (W19). You can get a sense of their journey and vision through this [story](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PPsHg3Ap_qw).

**Location and Size**: Based in New York City, NALA has grown to a team of 138 dedicated employees.

**Leadership & Partnerships**: The company is led under the guidance of Group Partner Tom Blomfield and has tailored their services to fit the needs of a diverse customer base.

**Products & Services**:
1. **Consumer Cross-Border Payments**: Accessible through [nala.com](http://nala.com), this product allows individuals to send money effortlessly to various emerging markets.
2. **Payment Rails for Africa**: Found at [rafiki.com](http://rafiki.com), this service enables businesses to leverage payment infrastructure tailored for the African market.

**Company Tags**: NALA operates within the fintech and payments sector and is especially focused on creating a seamless payment experience linked to the African market.

**User Testimonials**: Feedback from the community highlights that users appreciate NALA for its efficiency, reliability, and competitive rates. Many find it an ideal method for sending money home without hidden fees.

**Current Developments**:
- NALA is actively refining its offerings, including updates on their [roadmap](http://nala.com/<https:/www.notion.so/nalateam/NALA-Roadmap-057eef46825944f298233c316f24f6e9>) and feature releases, enhancing the user experience.
- The app is noted for its high ratingsâ€”4.8 on app storesâ€”reflecting strong consumer satisfaction.

**Future Aspirations**: NALA recognizes that billions are lost in outdated, costly cross-border fees annually. They aspire to address this with improved payment solutions that provide reliability and affordability, ultimately serving a global need.

**Website**: To learn more or to download their app, visit [nala.com](http://nala.com).

In summary, NALA is a forward-thinking fintech startup working to redefine how people send money internationally, especially to Africa, and theyâ€™re keen on making that process as efficient and transparent as possible for users. Their commitment to innovation in payments shows a keen understanding of both market needs and the technological possibilities available today.
